content.description: A killer route featuring a variety of interesting movement and cool holds. Some of the hardest climbing is right off the deck; move through three bolts of slippery, powerful climbing to a mini ledge rest. From here the climbing style changes character, using a mix of crimps, pockets and the rare jug. The climbing is technical and engaging on bullet stone. Quite solid for the grade.
content.location: on the right side of the swamp cave. This route is just right of 'Shelter from the Storm' and just left of 'Heart of Glass'.

content.description: A burly route. Hard moves right off the ground lead you into a steep rail feature. Tenuous positions through here finish with a dynamic move to a few jugs and a resting zone. Don't let down your guard quite yet... two unique and challenging sections are between you and the chains.
content.location: The rightmost route on the left side of the swamp cave. Often has fixed draws.

content.description: The most continuous of the three 5.10s in this area. Work through the pumpy bulge to a good rest, then climb to a slab finish.
content.protection: Mussy hooks (as of April 2023). 10 bolts total.
content.location: As for Alligator Skin, pass Swamp Cave and look for the short footpaths on the left.

content.description: A blocky and steep beginning leads to the vertical headwall above. Share anchors with the right trending 11b.
content.location: To the left of Swamp Thing, out the steep lefthand side of the swamp cave. To the right of the right trending 11b.

content.description: Begin the same as Heart of Glass, but trend right. A really nice route through a series of pockets. Movement is very interesting, a Swamp Cave classic!
content.location: Common start with Heart of Glass, on the right side of the Swamp cave

content.description: This is a decent route which is steeper than it looks.  Good easy 5.10 climbing leads to a powerful move to a pocket getting over a high bulge.  Chain anchors.
content.location: The first route right of Twist of Fate.  Climb low angle rock in a vague left-facing corner to a high first bolt.

content.description: Another great route. A perfect big brother to Tangled Up in Blue. The first four bolts are powerful, slippery and engaging. From here, the rock changes dramatically and the climbing eases off a little. Share the large hole rest with Tangled, and then carry on into hardening terrain. A thin crux is just a few bolts below the chains.
content.location: To the right of Brown Sugar, to the left of Tangled up in Blue.

content.description: Chossy climbing over low angle terrain to the high first bolt.  From here, the climbing continues to improve to really nice stone on some steeper gray rock at the top.   The crux is the upper steep part.   Flows perfectly if you start the sequence up high correctly.
content.location: 2 routes to the right of Simple Twist of Fate, just right of Sherpa James, climbing the same ledgeyÂ start. Look for the sheep skull at the base at about head height.

content.description:
The rig that conquers the center of the Swamp Cave cleaned up really nice, and offers a cool variety of holds and movement. Begin with a few bolts of easier climbing, then plant a right knee-bar for the routes main rest at about 1/3 height. Fire into a very continuous power endurance boulder problem that ends with the route's crux. Finish on the easier upper headwall. 

  4 stars for movement, 1.5 stars for rock quality (mostly in the easier sections though). However, definitely worth doing!!
content.location: The only route out the super steep center of the Swamp Cave.

content.description: A fun, thin route on good rock. Share the start with Simple Twist of Fate and continue straight up. Crimps and a few slopers make up a long and sustained crux through the midsection. Finish on easier terrain and share the anchor with Tangled Up in Blue.
content.location: To the right of Tangled Up in Blue. Shares the start with Simple Twist of Fate.

content.description: Of the 3 climbs in this section, this is probably the lowest quality.   The rock quality is fine, there's just nothing very unique about the movement.   It does the job for a warm up.
content.protection: Mussy hooks (as of April 2023). 9 bolts total.
content.location: As for the other lines here, venture past the Swamp Cave to the obvious footpaths just beyond the chert bands.

content.description: This is the second most leftward route on the wall.  There is a variation that goes straight up, but you will want to follow the right leaning series of features.  A good mix of pockets, pinches and jugs this steep line is one of the best 11 sport routes I have done.
content.protection: Bolts, not sure how many +/- 9 and anchors
content.location: Second from the left, make sure you go right, and not up where there is a variation

content.description: Route immediately left of Brown Sugar
content.location: Leftmost route on right side of cave.

content.description: Of the four main routes on the right side of the Swamp Cave this is the left most.  This classic route starts out with a challenging boulder problem which leads you through a steep section of rock. Once through this section you enter a long stretch of sustained face climbing.  AMAZING route!
content.location: There are four routes that are on the right hand side of the cliff, this is the left most of those.

content.description: Scramble up a shallow chert ramp to good holds on the bulging grey face, then thinner holds near the anchors. A good warm up for the nearby 10d and 11b routes.
content.protection: Mussy hooks (as of April 2023). 8 bolts total.
content.location: Just beyond the far edge of Swamp Cave, past the chaotic bands of black chert. Look for the short, well-defined footpaths which mark the start of each of the 5.10s in this area.

content.description: This is the cave that is located near the back of the canyon.  It is very shady as the canyon is narrow.  Very rare to find others climbing here.
